When you open the starmap, click on the 'navigation' tab.

In the bottom left there is a slider that lets you set the cargo tonnage for which you wish to see your range.

Cheers!

It also helps if you RTFM, or in this case, the onscreen instructions *facepalm*. Blue lines - jump distance within range for a fully laden ship. Grey lines - you can make the jump but will need to adjust your cargo tonnage accordingly.

Man, it's like figuring out the navball in KSP. Once you know what your instruments are actually telling you, the game gets a whole lot easier.

One additional thing with regards to jump planning:

Use the "mass slider" only after you made all ship upgrades / downgrades you want to make.

Every module and weapon in your ship has its own tonnage ... so using the slider before, for example, you ad a module with 4t of weight,

may result in a miscalculation of the cargo you can take on by up to 4 tons

Bought a Cobra!

*goes to Frontier forums*

*sees other people with anacondas*

How these people earn money so fast?

(well, i stopped playing for 10 days, that might explain it)

I finally got a Viper yesterday. Damn nice ship that seems to be a decent all-rounder for the price. It suits my style of play, especially with my new-found interest in trading. I've also been busy, and finally achieved one of my goals (that wasn't 'Get a Viper'). I finally found a station with the posh interior:

Vonarburg Co-operative in Wyrd. I knew one of these places would be around somewhere...

I got there through Nang Ta-Khian, and was surprised at how close this moon is to the planet. Surely it should have been ripped to pieces by tidal forces by now? Eh, still looks cool.

I also got a docking computer without realising what exactly it did. When it also started playing classical music, I started giggling. Good one, Frontier

For the record, I sold it back immediately. No damn computer is taking over my flying unless I get a Type-9 or an Anaconda...

So yes, things are starting to really look up for me, now. The age of despair is over. The age of avoiding bugs and glitches has begun. Seriously, I encountered a very bad bug before, but it wasn't debilitating in any way; it was quite the opposite. I bought some tobacco at Bolg in the hopes that perhaps Aulin would accept it. They didn't, so I fled to I Bootis and the black market there. Landed, went to the black market, did business, came out a bit better off. Then I decided that I'd do the crop harvester run to Eranin, but it said my cargo hold is still half full... with tobacco?! I checked, and sure enough, there's still the 4 tobacco in my hold. I checked to see if it was sell-able to the black market still, and it is. Oh my. I could've made infinite money... I could've had everything! EVERYTHING! Fortunately, my good judgement was in control and I quickly got the hell out of that menu, left the station, jumped to Eranin, and dumped and blasted that damned tobacco with my lasers.

So yes, I could have made myself the richest person in Elite with a few button presses. I guess it's a good thing I didn't do that, eh, or I'd be roaming around blasting everything in my Anaconda with plasma accelerators without a care in the world, heheh...heh...

I finally got a Viper yesterday (...) It suits my style of play, especially with my new-found interest in trading.

If you like trading, stay with the Hauler until you've got enough credits for the Cobra, the Hauler has 16 units of cargo compared to the 8 of the Viper.
